Package io.github.cantido.qlearner.agent

The Agent class is the entry point to this library.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Agent
    Performs Actions that will lead to changes in the Environment 's current State.
    AgentBuilder
    Builds Agent objects using the Builder pattern.
    Step
    A single State-Action pair choice made by an Agent during one iteration of its algorithm.

Package io.github.cantido.qlearner.agent Description

The Agent class is the entry point to this library. It has only one method: Agent.takeNextAction(). 
 Agent agent = ... ;
 
 while(true) {
     agent.takeNextAction();
 }
For real-world applications, you may want to allow some time for your actions to have an effect, and for your Environment to arrive at a new State: 
 while(true) {
     agent.takeNextAction();
     TimeUnit.MINUTES.sleep(1);
 }
If you are trying to reach a global state after which your program will exit, you will have to specify your own way of identifying that. Since your Environment is responsible for its own State, why not add a method to your Environment? 
 MyEnvironment myEnvironment = ... ;
 
 while(!myEnvironment.isAtGoalState()) {
     agent.takeNextAction();
     TimeUnit.MINUTES.sleep(1);
 }
If you ever need to reset your Agent while preserving its learned behavior, call Agent.reset(). This is important when you are trying to train your agent to find a goal state. For instance, if you are trying to teach your Agent how to play a game, then you will need to call Agent.reset() once the game ends, before you start your next game. If you don't, then the Agent will learn that it can make a move at the end of the game that will put it back at the beginning of the game! 
 while(isTraining) {
     myGameEnvironment.startGame();
     
     while(!myGameEnvironment.isAtGoalState()) {
         agent.takeNextAction();
     }
     // The game is over. Now, we have to reset the agent before we start the game again.
     
     agent.reset();
     myGameEnvironment.endGame();
 }
You can also create a brand new Agent object, just be sure to save the QualityMap that you created it with. The QualityMap is where the Agent stores its learned values, and represents the hard work you just performed.
